text: Din Tai Fung in Singapore offers an exquisite dim sum experience perfect for sharing. From the soft, savoury steamed pork buns to the crispy deep-fried wantons, every dish was thoughtfully prepared and full of flavour. Highlights included the Steamed Yam Paste Xiao Long Bao, lotus root-studded handmade tofu, and aromatic truffle fried rice finished tableside. The roselle drink added a refreshing, floral touch to round off the meal. While the century eggs remain an acquired taste, the overall experience was a memorable way to end our time in Singapore.
The restaurant is spacious and clean. The food is good. I rekomend the sweet and sour pork and fried rice. All the dimsum is good. The price high comes with the best experience and good taste.
The Xiao long bao and fried rice and other dishes were all good here. The restaurant is big but can get noisy during busy hours.
Great food, services and environment not too noisy during dinner. They allow food dietary restriction which is great! Food is delicious and healthy.
Good taste, good portion, a bit on expensive side but justified by the location. Crowded. Excellent service.
